thread.section_title: Entertainment News - Celebrities, Movies, TV, Music - CNN.com
thread.title: John Stamos charged with DUI in June incident
thread.title_full: John Stamos charged with DUI in June incident - CNN.com

author: Joe Sutton
title: John Stamos charged with DUI in June incident
text:
Story highlights Ex-"Full House" actor John Stamos is formally charged with driving under the influence Charge stems from his June 12 arrest in Beverly Hills (CNN) Actor John Stamos, known for his role in the sitcom "Full House," was formally charged Thursday with driving under the influence in June in Beverly Hills, California.
The actor, 52, faces one misdemeanor count of driving while under the influence of drugs, the Los Angeles County district attorney's office said .
Stamos was pulled over June 12 after police received calls about a motorist who was behaving strangely and driving erratically, prosecutors said. Stamos was the only occupant in his vehicle at the time.
Paramedics took him to a nearby hospital, where authorities came to the conclusion that he'd been driving under the influence and arrested him, police said in June.
12 photos: 'Full House': Where are they now? 12 photos: 'Full House': Where are they now? Fans of the the popular sitcom "Full House" have long been clamoring for a revival, and they'll finally get their wish. Netflix is working to bring back the show with original stars Candace Cameron Bure as D.J. and Andrea Barber as her best friend, Kimmy. Let's catch up with the cast. Hide Caption 1 of 12 12 photos: 'Full House': Where are they now? Former "Full House" stars, from left, John Stamos, Dave Coulier and Bob Saget got together again for a Dannon Oikos commercial for Super Bowl 2014. Hide Caption 2 of 12 12 photos: 'Full House': Where are they now? Candace Cameron Bure – Candace Cameron Bure, aka DJ Tanner, went on to play Summer Van Horne on ABC Family's "Make It or Break It." She also appeared on a 1997 episode of "Boy Meets World" and a 2007 episode of "That's So Raven." In addition to appearing on "Dancing With the Stars," she's continued to work as an actress and has written books about her life as a working wife and mother. She also made headlines in 2014 with statements about being "submissive" to her husband. Hide Caption 3 of 12 12 photos: 'Full House': Where are they now? Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen – After playing Michelle, Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen starred in "It Takes Two" and "Holiday in the Sun," among other flicks and TV series. Their last gig together was 2004's "New York Minute." Mary-Kate went on to play Tara on "Weeds" and appear in "The Wackness" and "Beastly." Offscreen, the twins have built an empire around several fashion labels, including The Row, Elizabeth and James, and Stylemint. Hide Caption 4 of 12 12 photos: 'Full House': Where are they now? Jodie Sweetin – After playing Stephanie, Jodie Sweetin appeared on "Party of Five" and "Yes, Dear." She hosted 2007's "Pants-Off Dance-Off," starred in 2008's "Small Bits of Happiness" and detailed her struggle with addiction in her 2010 memoir "unSweetened." Hide Caption 5 of 12 12 photos: 'Full House': Where are they now? Bob Saget – After playing Danny Tanner, Bob Saget channeled another widowed father on "Raising Dad." He hosted "America's Funniest Home Videos" and showed off his R-rated sense of humor in 2005's "The Aristocrats." Saget also narrated "How I Met Your Mother" on CBS. Hide Caption 6 of 12 12 photos: 'Full House': Where are they now? John Stamos – After playing Jesse Katsopolis, John Stamos went on to play Dr. Tony Gates on "ER." He appeared on "Glee's" second season, among other shows, and now stars in the Fox series "Grandfathered." Hide Caption 7 of 12 12 photos: 'Full House': Where are they now? Dave Coulier – Dave Coulier produced and starred in "Can't Get Arrested" and hosted "Animal Kidding" after playing Joey Gladstone. He appeared on "The Surreal Life" in 2004 and laced up his skates to compete on 2006's "Skating With Celebrities." He married girlfriend Melissa Bring in Montana in June 2014. Hide Caption 8 of 12 12 photos: 'Full House': Where are they now? Lori Loughlin – Lori Loughlin, or as we call her, Aunt Becky, starred on "Hudson Street" after "Full House" ended. She appeared on series "Summerland" and "In Case of Emergency" before acting alongside Robin Williams and John Travolta in the 2009 flick "Old Dogs" and taking on the role of Debbie Wilson on "90210." Hide Caption 9 of 12 12 photos: 'Full House': Where are they now? Dylan and Blake Tuomy-Wilhoit – Alex and Nicky Katsopolis were played by Dylan and Blake Tuomy-Wilhoit, respectively, from 1992 until the series finale. Ready to feel old? The adorable twins are legal. Jesse and Becky's boys were played by Kevin and Daniel Renteria during the show's fifth season. Hide Caption 10 of 12 12 photos: 'Full House': Where are they now? Andrea Barber – Andrea Barber retired from acting shortly after playing DJ's best friend, Kimmy Gibbler. But she came out of retirement to reprise the role in sketch with Dave Coulier , and now she's set to co-star in the Netflix revival. Hide Caption 11 of 12 12 photos: 'Full House': Where are they now? Scott Weinger – Since playing DJ's boyfriend Steve, Scott Weinger has continued voicing Aladdin in films such as "Aladdin and the King of Thieves." Weinger appeared on "Scrubs" and "What I Like About You"; he was also a writer on the WB series. He has worked as a writer-producer on The CW's "90210" as well. Hide Caption 12 of 12 It wasn't immediately clear Thursday why it took four months to file charges against Stamos. A spokesman for the district attorney's office said the Beverly Hills Police Department didn't present the case to prosecutors until October 6.
Read More Stamos faces a maximum sentence of six months in jail if convicted.
The actor is scheduled to be arraigned Friday, but since it's a misdemeanor case, an attorney can appear on his behalf without him being present.
The case remains under investigation by the Beverly Hills Police Department.
Stamos currently stars in the new Fox series "Grandfathered."
